a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality in the past vs today, 1960
Child mortality is measured as the share of children who die before their 5th birthday. Shown is the child mortality
rate in the selected year versus the rate today. Countries above the grey line have a lower child mortality rate today.
Child mortality rate in selected year
Data source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (via World Bank)
